main event: Three lights, the size of a silver dollar, were observed steadily burning and heading west in Oklahoma City on July 16, 1956.
interesting points: The lights were similar to aircraft lights and followed each other at a constant interval., Observers noted a thermic beat and described the lights as almost pulsing., The sighting lasted for two intervals of 15 minutes each., A letter received from the GCnd Observer Squadron corroborated the sighting., The reporting officer expressed an opinion that the lights were likely navigational lights.
sighted object: three steadily burning lights in the sky
witness description: one observer described the lights and their pulse-like appearance
